result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenneth Wade Maxwell Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kenneth Wade Maxwell Jr. is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kenneth Wade Maxwell Jr. was found guilty of Possession of Firearm by Felon [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "G" Felony], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court dismisses Counts 2, 3, 4 and 5.
Defendant to report to Probation by 5:00 p.m. Friday June 19, 2015 
Court authorizes Defendant's release Thursday June 18, 2015 when current sentence is completed.

 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: S. Correll  DF ATTY: Joseph R. Caton DF: Kenneth Wade Maxwell appeared from jail. Case called at 8:14. ADA Correll updates the court. Atty. Caton agrees.   Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct 1 in 15CF61. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 in 15CF61. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 2, 3, 4 and 5 in 15CF61. Sentencing arguments. Atty's waive a PSI. Court reserves the right to order at any future date. Ms. Maxwell makes statement. DE makes statement. Crt orders: W/H, 2 years probation
Conditions:
- 3 months I/S condition time
- DE have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Benita M. and her children.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent. 
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- domestic abuse assessment and any follow through if recommended
- AODA and follow through 
- mental health assessment and any follow through.
- Costs and supervision fees. 
- Random and regular UA's and PBT's.
- DE to investigate completing GED. 
-  ot to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
Court authorizes release on Thurs. June 18 when current sentence is completed. 
Court to sign up for probation by Fri. June 19, 2015 at 5:00pm.
to Dismiss: Insufficient Preliminary Examination filed by ADA Joseph Caton. eif
Plea hearing on June 16, 2015 at 08:00 am.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Matthew L Hartung DF ATTY: Joseph R. Caton DF: Kenneth Wade Maxwell appeared from jail. Case called at 9:15. Court reviews file. Atty. Caton withdraws his challenge to the bind over and requests a plea date.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 16, 2015 at 08:00 am.

** BOND AMENDED **

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

-Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each UA test with an officer of the same sex.

-No possession or use of any firearms.

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Bonita M.The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

- DE is allowed to have telephone contact and/or supervised physical contact only with his 5 children. 

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

filed by ADA Matthew Hartung. eif
filed by ADA Matthew Hartung. eif

** BOND AMENDED **

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

-Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each UA test with an officer of the same sex.

-No possession or use of any firearms.

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Bonita M.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

- DE is allowed to have telephone contact and/or supervised physical contact only with his 5 children. 

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
Arraignment on February 24, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Joseph Caton. DF ATTY: DF: Kenneth Wade Maxwell appeared from jail. Case called at 8:34. S/T Deputy R. Fowler. Direct by ADA Hartung. Deputy Fowler identifies DE in court. Cross by Atty. Caton. Court questions Deputy. Fowler. ADA Hartung addresses Ex #1-2007 version of MN statutes. Ex #2 -copy of MN JOC. O/R for purposes of the prelim. Atty. Caton makes arguement. Ex. #3- Register of Actions O/R. ADA Hartung makes argument. Atty. Caton makes argument. ADA Hartung responds. Court responds. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial.  Arraignment scheduled for February 24, 2015 at 09:30 am. Case re called for purposes of amending the bond. Ms. Bonita M. addresses the court. Court agrees to amend the bond. Court amends to supervised physical contact with DE children and approves telephone contact.
Preliminary hearing on February 19, 2015 at 08:15 am.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

-Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each UA test with an officer of the same sex.

-No possession or use of any firearms.

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Bonita M. or any of his 5 children.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
